definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: The thought fluttered in her mind like a flame-attracted moth .
sentences.chinese: 这想法有如被火光吸引的飞蛾在她心里扑腾着。

sentences.english: They jumped into the lake after finishing their chopping work and hurrayed out of joy.
sentences.chinese: 他们忙完手头的活就扑腾扑腾地跳下湖，大叫痛快。

sentences.english: They jumped into the lake after finishing their chopping work and hurrayed out of joy.
sentences.chinese: 他们忙完手头的活就扑腾扑腾地跳下湖，大叫痛快。

sentences.english: Tom beat about in the sea,trying not to drown.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆在海里乱扑腾，设法不被溺死。

sentences.english: Pigeons lifted from the roofs in a clatter of multicolored wings.
sentences.chinese: 鸽子在天花板下噼里啪啦地向上扑腾五颜六色的翅膀。

sentences.english: As he became excited, his heart began to palpitate more and more erratically .
sentences.chinese: 由于他非常兴奋，他心里开始扑腾越来越多的不稳定。

sentences.english: Quacking ducks are tossed up over the water one after another.
sentences.chinese: 一只只鸭子抛向空中，“嘎嘎”叫着扑腾到水面。

sentences.english: The thought fluttered in her mind like a flame-attracted moth.
sentences.chinese: 这想法有如被火光吸引的飞蛾在她心里扑腾着。

sentences.english: Over went the boat, and he found himself struggling in the river.
sentences.chinese: 船儿兜底翻了过来，鼹鼠在河里扑腾着挣扎。

sentences.english: Flopped like a fish against the muddy ground.
sentences.chinese: 他在泥泞的河底像一条鱼一样扑腾着。

sentences.english: The bird muddled the brook with its splashings.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在小河水面上扑腾，把河水搅浑。

definition: to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air
